servinfo.title: DTC P1674: CAN Communication (Bus Off Error)

entry.ptxt: Keyless start control module connector (if equipped) (viewed from harness side)
TCM connector (for A/T model) (viewed from harness side)
ABS hydraulic unit / control module connector (viewed from terminal side)
Combination meter connector (viewed from harness side)
4WD control module connector (viewed from harness side)
ABS hydraulic unit / control module assembly
ESP® control module connector (viewed from harness side)
Steering angle sensor connector (viewed from harness side)
Steering angle sensor (for vehicle with ESP®)

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Transmission error that is inconsistent between transmission data and transmission monitor (CAN bus monitor) data is detected more than 7 times continuously.

item.ptxt: Steering angle sensor (for vehicle with ESP®)

s1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC by using scan tool.
Start engine and run it for 1 min. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 2.
Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: DTC check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM, TCM (for A/T model), ABS / ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped), keyless start control module (if equipped) and BCM for DTC.

testgroup.question: Is there any DTC(s) other than CAN communication DTC(s) at each control module (other than DTC P1618, P1674, P1676, P1678, P1685 in ECM, DTC P1774, P1777, P1778 in TCM (for A/T model), DTC U1073, U1100, U1101, U1121, U1126, U1139, U1140, U1144 in BCM, ABS / ESP® control module and 4WD control module (if equipped) and DTC No.31 / 33 in keyless start control module (if equipped))?

action.ptxt: Go to applicable DTC diag. flow.
Go to Step 3.

testgroup.title: ECM, TCM (for A/T model), BCM, ABS / ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped), combination meter, keyless start control module (if equipped) and steering angle sensor (for vehicle with ESP®) connectors check

test1.ptxt: Check for proper connection at each ECM, TCM (for A/T model), BCM, ABS / ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped), combination meter, keyless start control module (if equipped) and steering angle sensor (for vehicle with ESP®) connector terminals with ignition switch turned OFF.
If connections are OK, recheck ECM for DTC with engine running.

testgroup.question: Is there DTC P1674?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 4.
Intermittent trouble. Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.title: ECM power and ground circuit check

test1.ptxt: Check ECM power and ground circuit referring to ECM Power and Ground Circuit Check .

testgroup.question: Are they in good condition?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 5.
Repair ECM power and/or ground circuits.

testgroup.title: DTC check in BCM, TCM (for A/T model), ABS / ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped) and keyless start control module (if equipped) (bus off)

test1.ptxt: Check DTC(s) in TCM (for A/T model), ABS / ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped) and BCM.

testgroup.question: Is there DTC(s) P1774 in TCM (for A/T model), U1073 in BCM, ABS / ESP® control module and 4WD control module (if equipped) and/or DTC No.33 in keyless start control module (if equipped)?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 7.

testgroup.title: DTC check in ECM (bus off)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check TCM (for A/T model), BCM, ABS / ESP® control module and 4WD control module (if equipped) for DTC(s).

testgroup.question: Is there DTC(s) P1774 in TCM (for A/T model), U1073 in BCM, ABS / ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped) and/or DTC No.33 in keyless start control module (if equipped)?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 7.
CAN communication circuit wire between ECM and ABS / ESP® control module is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Connect connectors to ECM and disconnect connector from BCM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC(s).

action.ptxt: Go to Step 8.
CAN communication circuit wire between BCM and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, substitute a known-good BCM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from TCM (for A/T model) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 9.
CAN communication circuit wire between TCM and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, substitute a known-good TCM (for A/T model) and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from keyless start control module (if equipped) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 10.

CAN communication circuit wire between keyless start control module and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, substitute a known-good keyless start control module and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from combination meter with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 11.

CAN communication circuit wire between combination meter and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, substitute a known-good combination meter or keyless start control module (if equipped) and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from 4WD control module (if equipped) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 12.
CAN communication circuit wire between 4WD control module and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, substitute a known-good 4WD control module and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from steering angle sensor (vehicle equipped with ESP® control module) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 13.

CAN communication circuit wire between steering angle sensor and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check steering angle sensor power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good steering angle sensor and recheck.

testgroup.title: ABS or EPS® control module check

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance at following connector terminals.

item.ptxt: Between “WHT/BLU” terminal and “WHT” terminal of ABS or ESP® control module connector.
Between “WHT/RED” terminal and “RED” terminal of ABS or ESP® control module connector.

testgroup.question: Is measured resistance below 1 Ω?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 14.
Substitute a known-good ABS or ESP® control module and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from all control modules (ECM, TCM (if equipped), BCM, ABS or ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped), keyless start control module (if equipped), combination meter, steering angle sensor (if equipped)) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check that CAN communication circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: All wire harness resistance of CAN communication circuit is less than 1 Ω between each control module.
Insulation resistance between CAN communication circuit wires is infinity at each control module connector.
Insulation resistance between each CAN communication circuit wire and vehicle body ground is infinity at each control module connector.
Circuit voltage of CAN communication circuit is 0 V with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 15.
Repair or replace defective CAN communication circuit.

test1.ptxt: Connect connectors to ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
Check ABS or ESP® control module power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good ABS or ESP® and recheck.
